page.title: 05The brick works in Nacolt
page.content: When we went to Nacolt we saw lots of derelict houses.we went over to look at one of them.Inside it there was glass on the floor and bricks and wood.The windows were bared up.I could see inside because the door was open.It was a real mess inside.I could only just see through the windows when I was on tiptoe.Then we went up to this dugout quarry.It used to be a dugout quarry but now it is a lake.It is quite big and it had trees in the water.It had ducks swimming on it.There are marsh frogs and great spotted orchids.There are Ramond Court Cottages near the brick works. These cottages were built in Victorian Times for the brickworkers and so were the Naccolt Cottages. Brook School is built from the bricks made at Naccolt Brick Works. The bricks are very red.
